page.title: 01Review of Bookham & Fetcham
page.content: This Block lies on the dip slope of the North Downs between the heavy clay landscape of{Bookham Common}in the NW and the chalk of{Fetcham Down}in the SE.{Leatherhead}is just to the NE and the A246 joins this town to the villages of Fetcham, Gt.& Lt. Bookham and Effingham and continues westward towards{Guildford.} 1985 marked the centenary of the opening of Bookham station on the Leatherhead to Effingham Junction line. In 1985 the M25 motorway is to be opened just to the N of the area. London is within 25 miles and the area is predominantly part of the commuter or "gin & tonic" belt. The{Green Belt} starts at the W edge of the block. Plenty of open spaces exist N and S of the houses. Bookham Common is owned by the {National Trust}and{Norbury Park} by Surrey County Council.
